alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:35PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 115 PM EDT... At 1235 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Miami Springs, or over Hialeah, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Miramar, Miami Beach, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Miami Gardens, North Miami, Doral, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Pinecrest, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, Miami Shores, North Bay Village, West Miami and El Portal. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
